intro: Vahea florida, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It is a member of the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces fruit that is a capsule containing numerous seeds. Vahea florida thrives in coastal and wet forest habitats, often growing near the shoreline. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment and is also valued for its ornamental beauty.
